Hospitalization Record.Chief Complaint: Fatigue and loss of appetite for 2 weeks

Present Illness.Onset: Started 2 weeks ago at home, gradual onset, followed by fatigue and loss of appetite. No known triggers
Present Illness.Main Symptoms: Fatigue and loss of appetite, persistent, moderate to severe, no relieving factors noted, worsened with activity
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Enlarged liver and abnormal liver function tests seen on examination
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: Evaluated by primary care two weeks ago, liver function tests revealed elevated AST and ALT levels. Referred to hospital for further evaluation and management.
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Mental state stable, sleep patterns disturbed due to fatigue, significantly reduced appetite, normal urination and bowel movements, unintentional weight loss of 5 kg

Past History.General Health Condition: Generally healthy, no significant past medical history
Past History.Infectious Disease History: No known history of infectious diseases

Personal History.Occupation and Working Conditions: Retired office worker, previously worked in an office setting
Personal History.Exposure History: No significant exposure to industrial toxins, dust, or radioactive substances

Marital and Family History.Family History: Parents deceased, father had hypertension, mother had diabetes. Siblings are healthy

Systematic Examination.Chest: Clear lung sounds, normal heart sounds

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Gastroenterology consultation confirmed hepatomegaly and raised liver enzymes
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: Liver function tests: AST 150 U/L, ALT 200 U/L, Bilirubin 2.5 mg/dL
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Patient history of symptoms, physical examination indicating hepatomegaly, abnormal liver function tests
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, toxic hepatitis ruled out based on patient history and lab results

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Patient admitted with symptoms suggestive of Hepatitis A. Diagnostic basis includes elevated liver enzymes, hepatomegaly, and history of fatigue and loss of appetite. Differential diagnosis includes other types of viral hepatitis and toxic hepatitis but clinical presentation and lab results point towards Hepatitis A.
Post-Admission Course Records.Daily Course Records: Recorded as per daily patient monitoring
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Dr. B. Williams observed steady condition, continued monitoring and supportive care
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Patient handover to night shift with no significant changes, continued monitoring advised
Post-Admission Course Records.Stage Summary: Intermediate stage summary indicates persistent liver enzyme elevations, no new symptoms, continued supportive treatment
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Infectious disease consultation firmed up the diagnosis of Hepatitis A

Surgery Related.Preoperative Summary: Procedure planned for abdominal drainage due to hepatomegaly
Surgery Related.Preoperative Discussion Records: Discussed approach, risks, and procedural details. Family consent obtained
Surgery Related.Anesthesia Preoperative Visit Records: Patient evaluated as low risk for anesthesia complications
Surgery Related.Anesthesia Records: General anesthesia used, patient tolerated well
Surgery Related.Surgery Records: Procedure completed, no immediate complications noted
Surgery Related.Surgery Instrument Count Records: All instruments accounted for after surgery
Surgery Related.Postoperative First Course Record: Stable post-procedure, monitoring for potential complications
Surgery Related.Anesthesia Postoperative Visit Records: Patient recovering well from anesthesia, stable vitals

Death Related.Death Case Discussion Records: Final discussion concluded cause of death related to complications of severe Hepatitis A and procedure-related factors
Death Related.Death Records: Patient passed away on 2nd December. Report completed by Dr. A. Smith

Post-Admission Course Records.Critically Ill Patient Care Records: Recorded as per hospital protocol for critically ill patient

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: Bed rest, IV fluids, liver function tests daily, consult Infectious Disease specialist
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: Administer acetaminophen for fever, antiemetics for nausea as needed

Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination Reports: Ultrasound of liver shows hepatomegaly, no focal lesions
Hospitalization Record.Temperature Chart: Regular monitoring of temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure recorded
Hospitalization Record.Special Examination Consent: Consent obtained for specialized liver function tests
Hospitalization Record.Critical Condition Notice: Family informed of patient's critical condition on multiple occasions

Infectious Diseases.Name: Hepatitis A
Infectious Diseases.Symptoms: Fatigue, loss of appetite, enlarged liver, abnormal liver function
Infectious Diseases.Differential Diagnosis: Other types of viral hepatitis, toxic hepatitis
